title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી પોતે ગયા ગુજરાત્ય<RHYME_211375>, રહ્યા ડભાણમાં દોય રાત્ય<RHYME_211375>; 
હતી સંતની મંડળી સાથ<RHYME_211376>, વળતાં વરતાલે આવિયા નાથ<RHYME_211376>.
gujarati.context: After leaving Gujarat, I spent the night in a village with my friends; we had fun and played together until dawn arrived.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં રહ્યા હરિ સંત સહુ, કરી લીલા આપ્યાં સુખ બહુ; 
રહ્યા પંચ રાત્ય પોતે તિયાં, પછી યાંથી બુધેજે આવિયા.
gujarati.context: Lord Hari's devotee remained happy and content, having enjoyed the play of life to its fullest; after five nights, he returned back to his original state with a deep understanding.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાંથી ચાલિયા સમર્થ સ્વામી, આવ્યા બોચાસણે બહુનામી; 
બામણ ગામને એકલબારે, પોતા સરસવણી મહી પારે.
gujarati.context: The lord went forth with strength and arrived at his home, a virtuous one with many names; alone in his village, he crossed the great sea of sorrow.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
જઈ પાદરે પાછા વળિયા, આવી વરતાલે સંતને મળિયા; 
ત્યાંથી ચાલી ઉમરેઠે ગયા, દેવા દર્શન પ્રસન્ન થયા.
gujarati.context: As one walks backwards to the past, the wise person meets their teacher; then they depart with a happy heart, having beheld God's vision.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
વાજાં વાજતે પધાર્યા શ્યામ<RHYME_211381>, આવ્યું સામૈયે સઘળું ગામ<RHYME_211381>; 
દીધાં દાસને દર્શન દાન<RHYME_211382>, રહી રાત્ય ચાલ્યા ભગવાન<RHYME_211382>.
gujarati.context: When Shyam's drumbeat resonates far and wide, I arrive at every village; all the world's in his beat. He gives sight to the blind and shows us the path, and even at night, the Lord moves Him forward.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ભાવ ગામના લોકને બહુ, આવ્યાં પુરબારાં મળી સહુ; 
તેને દર્શન દઈ દયાળ<RHYME_211383>, કરી કલ્યાણ ચાલ્યા કૃપાળ<RHYME_211383>.
gujarati.context: The couplet speaks of a person who has gained popularity and recognition among the people in their hometown, with many coming to seek their blessings and fortune; ultimately, they have earned divine vision and are now guiding others towards well-being.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
સંગે આપ્યોતો ભોજન થાળ<RHYME_211383>, યથાયોગ્ય જમ્યા તે દયાળ<RHYME_211383>; 
પછી આવ્યા ડડુસર ગામ<RHYME_211381>, કર્યો કઠલાલ્યે વિશરામ<RHYME_211381>.
gujarati.context: A guest's meal is as good as the host's intention; afterwards, they can return to their village in peace.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
આંતરોળી ઊંટડિયે મહાદેવ<RHYME_211384>, તિયાં પધાર્યા દેવાધિદેવ<RHYME_211384>; 
તિયાં શિવનાં દર્શન કીધાં, વસ્ત્ર સર્વે સેવકને દીધાં.
gujarati.context: The soul has realized the divine within, and through this inner knowledge, one has seen the vision of Shiva and served all with selfless love.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
આપ્યા રૂપૈયા મૂઠડી ભરી, પછી ત્યાંથી પધારિયા હરિ; 
આવ્યા લુવાંગ્ય સલકી ગામ<RHYME_211381>, પછી પ્રાંતિયે પધાર્યા શ્યામ<RHYME_211381>.
gujarati.context: The speaker has filled their heart with God, and then reached the destination of spiritual salvation; they have walked to their village after filling their soul with love for God, and then attained the state of Lord Shiva's abode.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાંથી ચાલિયા શ્યામ સુંદર<RHYME_211386>, આવ્યા વાલ્યમજી વિજાપર<RHYME_211386>; 
ત્યાંથી ગેરિતે ગયા ગોપાળ<RHYME_211383>, વિશનગ્ર પધાર્યા દયાળ<RHYME_211383>.
gujarati.context: Shyam Sundar and Vijapari walked away from that place, leaving a beautiful memory behind. Similarly, Gopala went his separate way, carrying the burden of sorrow in his heart.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
તિયાં જમાડ્યા બ્રાહ્મણ ઘણા, કરી મોદક મીસરી તણા; 
ત્યાંથી ગયા ઊંઝે મહેસાણે, તિયાં જનને જમાડ્યા પરાણે.
gujarati.context: Many Brahmins settled in those lands, making their fortunes and building grand homes; from there, they went to the city, and thus began the cycle of birth and death.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવ્યા કર્જીસણ નાથ<RHYME_211376>, સખા સાંખ્યયોગી હતા સાથ<RHYME_211376>; 
પછી મહારાજ મોટેરે આવ્યા, શહેરના સતસંગી બોલાવ્યા.
gujarati.context: The couplets describe two groups: the first group, considered inferior, was led by a king who came afterwards; the second group, consisting of noble companions, were summoned by the great king to converse with him in the city.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાંથી જેતલપુર પધાર્યા, જનને હૈયે હર્ષ વધાર્યા; 
એમ ફરી હરિ સર્વે ગામ<RHYME_211381>, કર્યાં છે નિજ જનનાં કામ<RHYME_211381>.
gujarati.context: As many joys as Jalpur's people have known, they rejoice with equal fervor; similarly, Hari is everywhere in every village, performing the deeds of its own people.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દાસ અર્થે ફર્યા સર્વે દેશ<RHYME_211391>, પછી કર્યો પંચાળે પ્રવેશ<RHYME_211391>; 
તિયાં દાસને દર્શન દીધાં, મળી નાથ કૃતારથ કીધાં.
gujarati.context: The slaves traversed the entire country, only to finally gain entry into their destined land through struggle. In the end, they were blessed with a vision, and it was all due to their own efforts.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી આવ્યો છે ફાગણ માસ<RHYME_211392>, થયા હોળી રમવા હુલાસ<RHYME_211392>; 
તિયાં હરિજનને તેડાવ્યા, દશ વીશ સંત પણ આવ્યા.
gujarati.context: The month of Phagun has arrived, bringing with it the joy of Holi celebrations and playful chaos. Even lowly Harijans have been honored, and ten thousand saints have gathered here.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી સુંદર આણ્યો સમાજ<RHYME_211393>, રંગ કેશર રમવા કાજ<RHYME_211393>; 
તેલ ફૂલેલ ગુલાલ ઘણા, મેલ્યો સમાજ ન રાખી મણા.
gujarati.context: After a beautiful youth is married into society, they spend their time playing with colors and makeup; many artificial flowers are arranged, but the real social gathering is not considered beautiful.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
સખા તાકી રહ્યા છે તયાર<RHYME_211394>, જમે જીવન એટલી વાર<RHYME_211394>; 
જ્યારે જમી લીધું છે જીવને, તિયાં આવીને ઘેરિયા જને.
gujarati.context: Life is a fleeting moment, so cherish it before it's too late; when life is gone, regrets will surround you like a prison.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
લાવ્યા રંગ સુરંગ ગુલાલ<RHYME_211396>, ઘેરી લીધા છે ઘરમાં લાલ<RHYME_211396>; 
છાંટે રંગ ઊડે છોળ્યું ઘણી, ચડી ગરદી ગુલાલ તણી.
gujarati.context: A colorful and vibrant life has been brought within the walls of one's home, with joy and love overflowing. With time, this beauty may fade, but memories of it will remain forever.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
રંગ સોરંગે રંગ્યા રંગીલો, રસ બસ થયા છે છબીલો; 
પછી નાથ કહે સુણો તમે, માગો ફગવા તે આપિયે અમે.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the joy and excitement of a colorful festival, where emotions are heightened and relationships are strengthened. It then encourages the listener to come together and enjoy this celebration with them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ કરી અલબેલે વાત<RHYME_211400>, સુણી જન થયા રળિયાત<RHYME_211400>; 
વારુ માગશું અમે મહારાજ<RHYME_211401>, દેજ્યો રાજી થઈ તમે રાજ<RHYME_211401>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet in English:

"It's said that once you're spoken to, your reputation will spread far; I ask for nothing from our king, but you've pleased him and taken his throne."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યારે રાજ કહે રાજી છૈયે, માગો મનમાન્યું અમે દૈયે; 
ત્યારે બોલ્યા જન જોડી હાથ<RHYME_211376>, તમ પાસે એ માગિયે નાથ<RHYME_211376>.
gujarati.context: When the time is right, we'll agree and accept your offer. But for now, keep your demands to yourself, don't ask us to join you in vain.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
મહાબળવંત માયા તમારી, જેણે આવરિયાં નરનારી; 
એવું વરદાન દીજિયે આપે, એહ માયા અમને ન વ્યાપે.
gujarati.context: The power of love is immense and can unite two souls who have been separated for ages. It bestows such a great gift that it does not even require the fulfillment of all desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી તમારે વિષે જીવન<RHYME_211405>, નાવે મનુષ્યબુદ્ધિ કોઈ દન<RHYME_211405>; 
જે જે લીલા કરો તમે લાલ<RHYME_211396>, તેને સમજું અલૌકિક ખ્યાલ<RHYME_211396>.
gujarati.context: Life is unpredictable, like a river that cannot be controlled; whatever you do, it will have its own unique outcome and understanding.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગી જે તમારા કહાવે, તેનો કેદી અભાવ ન આવે; 
દેશ કાળ ને ક્રિયાએ કરી, કેદિ તમને ન ભૂલિયે હરિ.
gujarati.context: The company of good people will not forget you even in old age; country, time, and karma may forget you, but God never will.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કામ ક્રોધ ને લોભ કુમતિ, મોહ વ્યાપીને ન ફરે મતિ; 
તમને ભજતાં આડું જે પડે, માગિયે એ અમને ન નડે.
gujarati.context: Desire and anger are overcome by greed, and one becomes ensnared in their own desires; one should worship with a humble heart, but pride prevents them from doing so.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
એટલું માગિયે છૈયે અમે, દેજ્યો દયા કરી હરિ તમે; 
વળી ન માગીએ અમે જેહ<RHYME_211409>, તમે સુણી લેજ્યો હરિ તેહ<RHYME_211409>.
gujarati.context: We ask for nothing from You, Lord, as you have already granted us your divine light. We don't request anything more, but rather surrender to Your will.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કેદિ દેશો મા દેહાભિમાન<RHYME_211382>, જેણે કરી વિસરો ભગવાન<RHYME_211382>; 
કેદિ કુસંગનો સંગ મા દેજ્યો, અધર્મ થકી ઉગારી લેજ્યો.
gujarati.context: The couplet expresses the idea that a person's dignity is lost when they are driven out of their country by circumstances, and they become susceptible to vices due to moral decay. Their once-proud self-respect is now lost, like a song forgotten in the din of worldly desires.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કેદિ દેશોમાં સંસારી સુખ<RHYME_211411>, દેશો મા પ્રભુ વાસ વિમુખ<RHYME_211411>; 
દેશો મા પ્રભુ જક્ત મોટાઈ<RHYME_211412>, મદ મત્સર ઇરષા કાંઈ<RHYME_211412>.
gujarati.context: Enjoyment in foreign lands is a fleeting pleasure, as the Lord's presence and power are not felt there; true happiness lies in devotion to the Lord.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દેશો માં દેહ સુખ સંયોગ<RHYME_211413>, દેશો મા હરિજનનો વિયોગ<RHYME_211413>; 
દેશો મા હરિજનનો અભાવ<RHYME_211414>, દેશો મા અહંકારી સ્વભાવ<RHYME_211414>.
gujarati.context: In one's own country, the body finds comfort and togetherness, but in others' lands, the sorrow of being an outcast; similarly, one's true self is absent in one's own country, while egotistical behavior prevails.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દેશો મા સંગ નાસ્તિકનો રાય<RHYME_211415>, મેલી તમને જે કર્મને ગાય<RHYME_211415>; 
એ આદિ નથી માગતા અમે, દેશો મા દયા કરીને તમે.
gujarati.context: The country's wealth is not mine to claim; let my karma be the song that sings you, and I will give you the light of the nation.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી બોલિયા શ્યામ સુંદર<RHYME_211386>, જાઓ આપ્યો તમને એ વર<RHYME_211386>; 
મારી માયામાં નહિ મૂંઝાઓ<RHYME_211416>, દેહાદિકમાં નહિ બંધાઓ<RHYME_211416>.
gujarati.context: Shyam is beautiful, go with that husband you have; Don't get entangled in my love or be trapped in your body.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
મારી ક્રિયામાં નહિ આવે દોષ<RHYME_211417>, મને સમજશો સદા અદોષ<RHYME_211417>; 
એમ કહ્યું થઈ રળિયાત<RHYME_211400>, સહુએ સત્ય કરી માની વાત<RHYME_211400>.
gujarati.context: In my actions, I do not find fault, and always understand the true nature; this is what I have said, and it is indeed a truthful statement.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
દીધા દાસને ફગવા એવા, બીજું કોણ સમર્થ એવું દેવા; 
એમ રમ્યા રંગભર હોળી, હરિ સાથે હરિજન ટોળી.
gujarati.context: People who are already oppressed by others cannot be freed by someone else; only with God's help can they gain freedom.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
થયા રસબસ રંગભીનો, ચાલો નાવા કહે નાથ દીનો; 
પછી પોતે થયા અસવાર<RHYME_211421>, સંગે ચાલિયા સખા અપાર<RHYME_211421>.
gujarati.context: As the sun sets over the ocean, we should enjoy our time together without worrying about tomorrow; after all, we will become dust and our songs will remain eternally.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ગાતાં વાતાં નાવા નાથ ગયા, કરી લીલા નાતાં નાતાં તિયાં; 
નાહી નાથ ચાલ્યા સખા સંગે, અતિ આનંદ ભર્યા છે અંગે.
gujarati.context: Those who wander in the material world have gone astray, but through play and joy, they've found solace. Without a goal, they've wandered carefree, filled with immense delight.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
આવ્યા સંત બે નાથે બોલાવ્યા, કહો અમ સારુ ભેટ શું લાવ્યા; 
કહે સંત લાવ્યા ફૂલહાર<RHYME_211394>, નાથ કહે આવો લાવો આ વાર<RHYME_211394>.
gujarati.context: A saint was called by two brothers, asking what gift they should bring; the saint replied, "Bring flowers and come in peace."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી અશ્વથી હેઠા ઊતર્યા, સંતે પુષ્પના શણગાર કર્યા; 
કંઠે આરોપ્યા ફૂલના હાર<RHYME_211421>, બાંધ્યા બાજુ તે શોભે અપાર<RHYME_211421>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a lotus flower that has been anointed with fragrance by the saints, and its petals have been adorned with flowers, making it majestic and unparalleled in beauty.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
તોરા ગજરા ફૂલના ધર્યા, કાને ગુચ્છ તે ફૂલના કર્યા; 
બાંયે બેરખા કંકણ સાર<RHYME_211424>, કર્યા ફૂલ તણા શણગાર<RHYME_211424>.
gujarati.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a flower that is tenderly cared for and its fragrance wafts to one's ears, much like a sweet surprise. The speaker compares this experience to wearing fine ornaments, enjoying the sweetness and beauty around them.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધૂપ દીપ ઉતારી આરતી, કરી કર જોડીને વિનતિ; 
કરી પૂજા ને લાગિયા પાય<RHYME_211425>, નીર્ખી નાથ ત્રપત ન થાય<RHYME_211425>.
gujarati.context: The couplet encourages one to offer their troubles and worries to God, seeking solace in divine protection, which can bring peace and calmness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
શ્યામ સલુણો શોભે છે અતિ, મનોહર સુંદર મૂરતિ; 
નયણાં ભરીને નીર્ખે છે જન<RHYME_211427>, જોઈ જીવન થયા મગન<RHYME_211427>.
gujarati.context: Shyam's beauty is extraordinary, with a mesmerizing and lovely complexion; it's the reflection of the soul that has experienced the joys and sorrows of life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
જય જય કહે નિજ દાસ, લીધું સુખ દીધું અવિનાશ; 
કરી લીળા અલૌકિક શ્યામે, શોભાવંત સારંગપુર ગામે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summary of the Gujarati couplet:

I have found eternal bliss, without end; I have obtained joy through my own self-effort.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

gujarati.couplet:
કર્યો સમૈયો સુંદર જાણો, ફાગણ સુદિ પૂન્યમ પ્રમાણો; 
તે દિવસે નાથે લીલા કીધી, પછી સર્વેને શીખ જ દીધી.
gujarati.context: A beautiful deed is done with great intention and reward; on that day, no one could say no to the proposal, and everyone was taught a valuable lesson afterwards.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 64: Shrī Haricharitre Mahārāj Sārangpur Padhāryā

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī pote gayā Gujarātya, rahyā Ḍabhāṇmā doy rātya; <RHYME_1>
Hatī santnī manḍaḷī sāth, vaḷatā Varatāle āviyā Nāth.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the departure of a Gujarati woman to her in-laws' home after marriage, leaving behind her childhood and family. The woman now follows her husband's guidance, with her happiness and sorrow bound together like a cart's load tied to its pole.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā rahyā Hari sant sahu, karī līlā āpyā sukh bahu; <RHYME_2>
Rahyā panch rātya pote tiyā, pachhī yāthī Budheje āviyā.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: A devotee of God Hari lives a peaceful life, enjoying divine play and prosperity; after five days, the wise one returns home, having gained eternal wisdom.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī chāliyā samarth Swāmī, āvyā Bochāsaṇe bahunāmī; <RHYME_3>
Bāmaṇ gāmne ekalbāre, potā sarasavaṇī mahī pāre.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The Lord's power is immense and limitless, capable of carrying devotees across even the vast ocean of worldly desires. Just as the river Saraswati flows effortlessly through the earth, the Lord's grace can lift one up to great heights with ease.

transliteration.couplet:
Jaī pādare pāchhā vaḷiyā, āvī Varatāle santne maḷiyā; <RHYME_4>
Tyāthī chālī Umreṭhe gayā, devā darshan prasanna thayā.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet:

The path to salvation is hidden and only revealed in hindsight, but one who has experienced it remains peaceful; after taking this journey, one's soul becomes pleased with the divine vision.

transliteration.couplet:
Vājā vājate padhāryā Shyām, āvyu sāmaiye saghaḷu gām; <RHYME_5>
Dīdhā dāsne darshan dān, rahī rātya chālyā Bhagwān.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context:
Shyam is wandering in search of his beloved, roaming the villages with the full moon; he has taken an oath to meet her at dawn.

Shyam has a divine appointment with his love at dawn, having previously made a vow to meet her.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhāv gāmnā lokne bahu, āvyā purbārā maḷī sahu; <RHYME_6>
Tene darshan daī dayāḷ, karī kalyāṇ chālyā kṛupāḷ.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: A person's character is known in their hometown, and their true nature is revealed when they cross the sea; their merciful behavior is seen in the way they treat others.

transliteration.couplet:
Sange āpyoto bhojan thāḷ, yathāyogya jamyā te dayāḷ; <RHYME_7>
Pachhī āvyā Ḍaḍusar gām, karyo Kaṭhalālye visharām.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: A good meal is savored with company, just as one would take pity on those who are worthy; later, one returns to their own village, having exhausted their strength.

transliteration.couplet:
Āntaroḷī ūnṭaḍiye Mahādev, tiyā padhāryā devādhidev; <RHYME_8>
Tiyā Shivnā darshan kīdhā, vastra sarve sevakne dīdhā.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: Lord Shiva, residing within the heart (Antar), is worshipped by all gods and devas; He bestows His divine vision to Shivna, granting her clothes to wear.

transliteration.couplet:
Āpyā rūpaiyā mūṭhaḍī bharī, pachhī tyāthī padhāriyā Hari; <RHYME_9>
Āvyā luvāngya salakī gām, pachhī Prāntiye padhāryā Shyām.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context: The devotee's heart is filled with devotion to Hari (God), and their steps are guided by His path. Similarly, the lover's heart is filled with love for their beloved, and their journey is guided by Prantie (the path of separation).

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī chāliyā Shyām sundar, āvyā vālyamjī Vijāpar; <RHYME_10>
Tyāthī gerite gayā Gopāḷ, Vishnagra padhāryā dayāḷ.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context: The beautiful Shyama (a type of flower) has bloomed in my life, and I am grateful for the love that Vijapar (the beloved) has shown me. Just like Gopal's mercy, our love is pure and selfless.

transliteration.couplet:
Tiyā jamāḍyā brāhmaṇ ghaṇā, karī modak mīsarī taṇā; <RHYME_11>
Tyāthī gayā Ūnze Mahesāṇe, tiyā janne jamāḍyā parāṇe.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a Brahmin's spiritual journey from worldly attachments (modak) to inner peace (Mahesane), and finally, to the ultimate reality (parane).

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvyā Karjīsaṇ Nāth, sakhā sānkhya-yogī hatā sāth; <RHYME_12>
Pachhī Mahārāj Moṭere āvyā, shahernā satasangī bolāvyā.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context: The devotee is saying that Lord Krishna, the master of all, accompanied him on his spiritual journey, as a friend and companion. He is also reminding that in Vrindavan, Maharaj used to call out in the assembly of saints, proclaiming the divine love.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāthī Jetalpur padhāryā, janne haiye harṣh vadhāryā; <RHYME_13>
Em farī Hari sarve gām, karyā chhe nij jannā kām.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: Life's journey is like a pilgrimage to Jetalpur, where one experiences joy and sorrow; ultimately, it leads us back to God. Our entire life's work is to find our own true purpose, which is in harmony with God's will.

transliteration.couplet:
Dās arthe faryā sarve desh, pachhī karyo Panchāḷe pravesh; <RHYME_14>
Tiyā dāsne darshan dīdhā, maḷī Nāth kṛutārath kīdhā.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

In order to fulfill one's duties and achieve salvation, one must enter the path of Panchayat; only then can one see God and gain His blessings.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī āvyo chhe Fāgaṇ mās, thayā Hoḷī ramavā hulās; <RHYME_15>
Tiyā Harijanne teḍāvyā, dash vīsh sant paṇ āvyā.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The festival of Holi brings joy and celebration to the streets, filling the air with colors and music. On this day, people gather together in the name of Lord Hari, forgetting their differences and coming together in harmony.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī sundar āṇyo samāj, rang keshar ramavā kāj; <RHYME_16>
Tel fūlel gulāl ghaṇā, melyo samāj na rākhī maṇā.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context: A beautiful community is one where everyone is in harmony and respects each other's boundaries, like the beauty of a rose.

transliteration.couplet:
Sakhā tākī rahyā chhe tayār, jame jīvan eṭalī vār; <RHYME_17>
Jyāre jamī līdhu chhe jīvane, tiyā āvīne gheriyā jane.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: A good friend remains near until the end of one's life, just as a tree stands firm until its fruit is ripe. Even when one's life force leaves the body, the place where they lived becomes unknown.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāvyā rang surang gulāl, gherī līdhā chhe gharmā lāl; <RHYME_18>
Chhānṭe rang ūḍe chhoḷyu ghaṇī, chaḍī garadī gulāl taṇī.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context: The colors of love are vibrant and warm, like a beautiful festival in full bloom. Just as the moonlight brings out the beauty of flowers, our love is radiant and lovely.

transliteration.couplet:
Rang sorange rangyā rangīlo, ras bas thayā chhe chhabīlo; <RHYME_19>
Pachhī Nāth kahe suṇo tame, māgo fagavā te āpiye ame.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: The colors of life are vibrant and radiant, but true bliss lies in the inner beauty. Listen to your inner self and let go of worldly attachments, for that is where true joy resides.

transliteration.couplet:
Em karī Alabele vāt, suṇī jan thayā raḷiyāt; <RHYME_20>
Vāru māgashu ame Mahārāj, dejyo rājī thaī tame rāj.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context: The winds of change are coming, and the foolish will be swept away; only those who have the blessings of the King (or God) will remain in their rightful place.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyāre rāj kahe rājī chhaiye, māgo manmānyu ame daiye; <RHYME_21>
Tyāre bolyā jan joḍī hāth, tam pāse e māgiye Nāth.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: One should be patient and calm in the face of royal power, and let their ego subside; similarly, one's hands should be empty before approaching God.

transliteration.couplet:
Mahā-baḷvant māyā tamārī, jeṇe āvariyā narnārī; <RHYME_22>
Evu varadān dījiye āpe, eh māyā amane na vyāpe.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: The great and mighty Maya is yours, who knows no bounds or limits; May that Maya be granted to you, so that it may not spread beyond you.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī tamāre viṣhe jīvan, nāve manuṣhya-buddhi koī dan; <RHYME_23>
Je je līlā karo tame lāl, tene samaju alaukik khyāl.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: Life is a precious gift to you, and I offer my intelligence as a donation. Let us together create a divine play, and may our extraordinary imagination be fulfilled.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangī je tamārā kahāve, teno kedī abhāv na āve; <RHYME_24>
Desh kāḷ ne kriyāe karī, kedi tamane na bhūliye Hari.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: One who has a friend like you, will never feel empty or alone again. Even the Lord won't be forgotten by someone who performs their duties with dedication and focus.

transliteration.couplet:
Kām krodh ne lobh kumati, moh vyāpīne na fare mati; <RHYME_25>
Tamane bhajatā āḍu je paḍe, māgiye e amane na naḍe.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: Desire and anger lead to greed and ignorance, but self-control remains unaffected by them. In your presence, my worries disappear, and peace prevails without a doubt.

transliteration.couplet:
Eṭalu māgiye chhaiye ame, dejyo dayā karī Hari tame; <RHYME_26>
Vaḷī na māgīe ame jeh, tame suṇī lejyo Hari teh.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: When I'm in trouble, I call out to God, and He has mercy on me; even if I don't ask for help, He listens to my prayers anyway.

transliteration.couplet:
Kedi desho mā dehābhimān, jeṇe karī visaro Bhagwān; <RHYME_27>
Kedi kusangno sang mā dejyo, adharma thakī ugārī lejyo.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: The proud one who thinks they are separate from God will be punished by Him; and the one who is humble and willing to admit their mistake will be freed from the cycle of sin.

transliteration.couplet:
Kedi deshomā sansārī sukh, desho mā Prabhu vās vimukh; <RHYME_28>
Desho mā Prabhu jakta moṭāī, mad matsar iraṣhā kāī.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one's worldly happiness is fleeting and can vanish like a bird leaving its nest. One should instead focus on pleasing the Lord, for it brings eternal joy and fulfillment.

transliteration.couplet:
Desho mā deh sukh sanyog, desho mā Harijanno viyog; <RHYME_29>
Desho mā Harijanno abhāv, desho mā ahankārī swabhāv.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The union of the self with God brings happiness, and separation from God leads to distress. The absence of God's presence leaves one with a natural inclination towards egoistic tendencies.

transliteration.couplet:
Desho mā sang nāstikno rāy, melī tamane je karmane gāy; <RHYME_30>
E ādi nathī māgatā ame, desho mā dayā karīne tame.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: The couplet suggests that one should not judge others based on their actions, as they may be performing good deeds in secret. Instead, have mercy on all beings, just like the divine has mercy on us.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī boliyā Shyām sundar, jāo āpyo tamane e var; <RHYME_31>
Mārī māyāmā nahi mūnzāo, dehādikmā nahi bandhāo.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: Shyam's beauty is praised in the rear, and he is called to come with that glory; his physical form is not bound by Maya or attachment.

transliteration.couplet:
Mārī kriyāmā nahi āve doṣh, mane samajasho sadā adoṣh; <RHYME_32>
Em kahyu thaī raḷiyāt, sahue satya karī mānī vāt.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: One should not blame others for their own mistakes, instead recognizing one's own errors as flaws. True wisdom lies in accepting the truth and learning from one's own experiences.

transliteration.couplet:
Dīdhā dāsane fagavā evā, bīju koṇ samarth evu devā; <RHYME_33>
Em ramyā rangbhar Hoḷī, Hari sāthe harijan ṭoḷī.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context:
The summary is:

"The devotee's love for God grows like a tree, and only the worthy can understand this divine connection."

transliteration.couplet:
Thayā rasbas rangbhīno, chālo nāvā kahe Nāth dīno; <RHYME_34>
Pachhī pote thayā asavār, sange chāliyā sakhā apār.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes the beauty of a soulmate who is forever bound to you, and together they take great strides in life's journey. Their love is unmatched, like an unbreakable bond between two trees that grow together.

transliteration.couplet:
Gātā vātā nāvā Nāth gayā, karī līlā nātā nātā tiyā; <RHYME_35>
Nāhī Nāth chālyā sakhā sange, ati ānand bharyā chhe ange.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna, the supreme master, played his flute with joy, and the gopis danced in ecstasy. He left His divine companions to frolic freely, overflowing with bliss.

transliteration.couplet:
Āvyā sant be Nāthe bolāvyā, kaho am sāru bheṭ shu lāvyā; <RHYME_36>
Kahe sant lāvyā fūlhār, Nāth kahe āvo lāvo ā vār.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: The saint says God is silent, and I have nothing to say; but God says come closer, let us speak of this moment.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī ashvathī heṭhā ūtaryā, sante puṣhpanā shaṇagār karyā; <RHYME_37>
Kanṭhe āropyā fūlnā hār, bāndhyā bāju te shobhe apār.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context:
In a peaceful atmosphere, one should cultivate good virtues and habits.
Adorn oneself with the beauty of modesty and humility.

transliteration.couplet:
Torā gajarā fūlnā dharyā, kāne guchchha te fūlnā karyā; <RHYME_38>
Bāye berakhā kankaṇ sār, karyā fūl taṇā shaṇagār.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: A delicate flower is carefully placed on the nose, and a garland of flowers is created from it. A noble one's beauty is reflected in their refined behavior, which is like a fragrant flower unfolding.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhūp dīp utārī āratī, karī kar joḍīne vinati; <RHYME_39>
Karī pūjā ne lāgiyā pāy, nīrkhī Nāth trapat na thāy.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context: The aroma of incense and lamp is offered to the divine, while the devotee humbly seeks the Lord's protection. The act of worship has brought solace, shielding one from worldly troubles.

transliteration.couplet:
Shyām saluṇo shobhe chhe ati, manohar sundar mūrati; <RHYME_40>
Nayaṇā bharīne nīrkhe chhe jan, joī jīvan thayā magan.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The beauty of Shyam's face is excessive and captivating. It's as if the whole world has gathered to gaze at it, mesmerized by its charm.

transliteration.couplet:
Jay jay kahe nij dās, līdhu sukh dīdhu Avināsh; <RHYME_41>
Karī līḷā alaukik Shyāme, shobhāvant Sārangpur gāme.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: May you find eternal happiness and peace with your true self, while others may enjoy temporary pleasures in this world. May your extraordinary spirit shine bright like a gem in the town of Sārangpur.

transliteration.couplet:
Karyo samaiyo sundar jāṇo, Fāgaṇ sudi Pūnyam pramāṇo; <RHYME_42>
Te divase Nāthe līlā kīdhī, pachhī sarvene shīkh ja dīdhī.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context:
In a beautiful era, one should know the value of good deeds, and in life's play, one should not forget their own destiny.

God plays his game on both individual and collective levels.
